custom_nodes.author: #NOTICE_1.13
custom_nodes.title: NOTICE: This channel is not the default channel.
custom_nodes.description:
If you see this message, your ComfyUI-Manager is outdated.
Recent channel provides only the list of the latest nodes. If you want to find the complete node list, please go to the Default channel.
Making LoRA has never been easier!

custom_nodes.author: 852wa
custom_nodes.title: ComfyUI-ColorshiftColor
custom_nodes.description:
This is a custom node for ComfyUI.
It reduces colors based on a specified number and allows for adjustments to hue, saturation, and brightness.
Features:Each parameter can be set to random, You can toggle masking (not changing colors) using color numbers, Mask inversion can also be toggled on or off.

custom_nodes.author: 852wa
custom_nodes.title: ComfyUI-AdvancedAlphaProcessor
custom_nodes.description:
This is a custom node for ComfyUI.
Features:Removes white areas in the input image by making them transparent based on brightness, Outputs in black and transparent, Outputs in gray and transparent.
This is a simple node with the above functionalities implemented. It also supports sequential processing.

custom_nodes.author: jinanlongen
custom_nodes.title: ComfyUI Prompt Expander Node
custom_nodes.description: A custom node for ComfyUI that expands text prompts using the SuperPrompt-v1 T5 model. This node helps generate more detailed and descriptive prompts from simple input text, which can be particularly useful for image generation workflows.

custom_nodes.title: ComfyUI DINO-X Detector Node

custom_nodes.title: ComfyUI-SendToDiscord
custom_nodes.description: ComfyUI-SendToDiscord is a custom node for ComfyUI that simplifies sending preview images to Discord via webhooks. It supports both single-image uploads and batch mode, making it an efficient tool for sharing your generated images directly with your Discord server.

custom_nodes.author: DJ-Tribefull

custom_nodes.author: KLL535
custom_nodes.title: ComfyUI_SimpleButcher
custom_nodes.description: I needed to automate the process of generating images and I did not find ready-made simple solutions for this, so I wrote my own. The idea is to repeat the functionality of forge: the script 'Prompts from file or textbox'. So that you can easily sort through pre-prepared lists of prompts, lora, styles, and connect text as you like. The resulting images must be compatible with Forge, and ideally, no different from it. The problem is that Forge uses the internal name from the Lora file metadata as the lora name, not the file name. Therefore, all existing solutions simply did not understand my templates. I would also like it if lore could be written in any order and any quantity in a text file in this format: <lora:name:1.0> or <lora:name:unet=1.0:te=0.75> and this would be applied automatically, without the need to create nodes for each lora separately. I would like the civitai site to understand metadata, the closest to this was the alexopus/ComfyUI-Image-Saver project, but it loses lora written in Forge style, by internal name.

custom_nodes.author: GoingAI1998
custom_nodes.title: ComfyUI Web Canvas Node
custom_nodes.description: # ComfyUI_imgcanvas At present, I have not used the useful comfyui custom node about layer mixing, and I have written a comfyui runtime automatic pop-up window for layer editing node

custom_nodes.author: fblissjr
custom_nodes.title: ComfyUI-EmbeddingPipelineAnalytics
custom_nodes.description: this repo is to capture end-to-end data, metadata, and embeddings for ComfyUI workflows, specifically HunyuanVideo to start.

custom_nodes.author: WUYUDING2583
custom_nodes.title: Save Image With Callback
custom_nodes.description: This node enables integration between ComfyUI and external services by adding callback capabilities to the image saving process. When an image is saved, the node automatically call your webhook with your specified URL with custom data.
